intro: Ixia alticola, commonly known as the rock lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Ixia alticola is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to arid or semi-arid climates. Its unique floral structure and vibrant colors make it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
